content.description:
The easiest route here. The climbing starts easy enough up the obvious corner at the left side of the East Face.

After a couple of ledges the climb gets surprisingly steep. Using an obvious undercling it is possible to gain a large hold. Make a couple more moves up to the anchors.
content.location: Leftmost route on the East Face.

content.description: Interesting climbing up a slab to powerful moves over a roof (crux) and finishes with easier but engaging moves to the anchors.
content.location:
Center of the narrow east face between

Strainer

and Fish Food.

climbs.name: Oso Smokey
climbs.fa: (TR) Tyler Logan, Loren Scott & Chuck Scott, 1995, FL: Tyler Logan & Chris Miller, June 1997

content.description:
This route is a powerful undertaking, with its distinct crux at the top.

The first 1/3 is easy enough.   The middle section involves nice technical climbing up the arete, after which a good resting spot is reached.   The last 1/3 of the climb is powerful, and requires determination to pass the last bolt and continue to the anchors.

A nice climb.
content.location: Rightmost route on the East Face
